document.heading: Youth Offender Community Service Amendment Act of 1989

history.narrative: Law 8-61, the “Youth Offender Community Service Amendment Act of 1989,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-138, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 27, 1989, and July 11, 1989, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on August 1, 1989, it was assigned Act No. 8-84 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
